chapter.title: JadeTeX Release Notes
chapter.para: JadeTeX is a companion package to the OpenJade DSSSL processor. OpenJade applies a DSSSL stylesheet to an SGML or XML document. The output of this process can be in a number of forms, including a set of high level LaTeX macros. It is the task of the jadetex package to transform these macros into DVI, PostScript or Portable Document Format (PDF) form.

sect1.title: Version 3.12

formalpara.title: Released January 2002.
formalpara.para: This release is primarily a maintenance release and is intended to be used with openjade 1.3.1. In addition to fixing some bugs it also provides enhanced support for the "euro" monetary symbol €.

sect1.para: Installation notes are provided in the install guide index.htm provided with the release.
The latest version of jadetex may be obtained from http://jadetex.sourceforge.net

entry.para: Using the reference € does not produce any output. Using the unicode character reference produces a black square unless a Computer Modern font is being used.

Switched to the marvosym.sty package for the euro symbol. This is provides a good quality postscript font containing the euro symbol. Some consideration was given to using Adobe's freely available euro fonts and the eurosans.sty package. However as the adobe fonts cannot be distributed freely this option was not chosen. In addition, the marvosym.sty package is available in most modern TeX distibutions.
Additionaly, support was added for the € entity reference.
Many commonly installed fonts such as Charter and Utopia are not available for use with jadetex

Added the following fonts: Utopia, ZapfChancery, Fibonacci, Funny, Dunhill, Concrete, Charter, Fontpxr, Fontaer, Fontaess, Fontaett, Fontlcmss, Fontlcmtt, Fontlcmvtt, Fontcmbr, Fontcmtl, Fontpxss, Fonttxss, Fonttxr. Note that this justs makes the fonts available to jadetex. You must have them installed already to actually use them in documents

row.entry: Long directory/file names disappear of the page

entry.para: If there is a long directory path in a document it goes off the side of the page. Long pathnames should be split or put on a separate line so that they don't go off the edge of the page.
Added '\setlength\emergencystretch{2in}'. In case of overfull hboxes, an extra stretchable length gets added to the end of the lines.

row.entry: Add DESTDIR environment variable to Makefile

entry.para: Makefile doesn't have DESTDIR environment variable
Make makefile more friendly for packagers with introduction of DESTDIR environment variable. This change is transparent to those that don't want to use DESTDIR.

row.entry: Fix fatal error with unbalanced columns

entry.para: The TeX multicol package supports both balanced and unbalanced columns. However, jadetex 3.11 didn't call the functions for unbalanced columns correctly. Since a bug in the handling of %page-balanced-columns?% was fixed in 3.11, this is now the common case - so multicolumn documents that used to work in 3.10 no longer work
Reworked the invocation of the unbalanced column macros. It isn't pretty, but it works.

row.entry: Graphics centered within page not column

entry.para: External Graphics are centered with respect to the entire page. This causes a problem in multicolumn mode.
External Graphics are now centered within the column width

row.entry: Fix for space above horizontal rule

entry.para: A horizontal rule has spurious blank space above it
Added \nointerlineskip to suppress the blank space
